1.text: And Bildad the Shuhite answereth and saith:—

2.text: When do ye set an end to words? Consider ye, and afterwards do we speak.

3.text: Wherefore have we been reckoned as cattle? We have been defiled in your eyes!

4.text: (He is tearing himself in his anger.) For thy sake is earth forsaken? And removed is a rock from its place?

5.text: Also, the light of the wicked is extinguished. And there doth not shine a spark of his fire.

6.text: The light hath been dark in his tent, And his lamp over him is extinguished.

7.text: Straitened are the steps of his strength, And cast him down doth his own counsel.

8.text: For he is sent into a net by his own feet, And on a snare he doth walk habitually.

9.text: Seize on the heel doth a gin, Prevail over him do the designing.

10.text: Hidden in the earth is his cord, And his trap on the path.

11.text: Round about terrified him have terrors, And they have scattered him—at his feet.

12.text: Hungry is his sorrow, And calamity is ready at his side.

13.text: It consumeth the parts of his skin, Consume his parts doth death’s first-born.

14.text: Drawn from his tent is his confidence, And it causeth him to step to the king of terrors.

15.text: It dwelleth in his tent—out of his provender, Scattered over his habitation is sulphur.

16.text: From beneath his roots are dried up, And from above cut off is his crop.

17.text: His memorial hath perished from the land, And he hath no name on the street.

18.text: They thrust him from light unto darkness, And from the habitable earth cast him out.

19.text: He hath no continuator, Nor successor among his people, And none is remaining in his dwellings.

20.text: At this day westerns have been astonished And easterns have taken fright.

21.text: Only these are tabernacles of the perverse, And this the place God hath not known.
